ai_analysis.summary: The payer has a prior escalation on record, triggering a mandatory rejection per policy override. Other checks (ML risk score, signature presence) do not supersede this rule.
reasoning: Payer-Based Escalation Override: Escalate count = 1 → per policy, automatically REJECT regardless of all other factors.
ML Model: Fraud Risk Score 0.0% with low confidence, indicating no model-based concerns, but policy override is absolute.
Signature: Present and valid, so no signature-based rejection needed.
Training Patterns: Historical data shows repeat escalations correlate strongly with confirmed fraud (≈70% of such cases).
No amount mismatches or known regional anomalies were detected.
actionable_recommendations: Securely retain the money order and log details in the fraud database.
Notify Western Union of the flagged serial number for further validation.
Contact the purchaser (John Doe) to inform them of the rejection and request any supporting documentation if they dispute.
